task.title: Configure SSL for the User Console
task.shortdesc: This topic details tasks required to configure SSL for the User Console.

context.p: When the user console service is run for the first time, it will generate a self-signed certificate and key which will be put into /etc/eucalyptus-console/. If you do not want to have a certificate and key generated and would like to use your own, you can disable automatic generation of the certificate and key.
To disable automatic generation of the console certificate and key, perform the following task.

info.note: If you choose not to use the default SSL certificate and key, you must provide your own. For more information on generating self-signed SSL certificates, go to http://www.akadia.com/services/ssh_test_certificate.html.

context.p: If you don't use the self-signed certificate and key that are provided by the User Console, you will need to provide your own.
